data.event: Added support for improved TRM collision handling in the classic tagger.
Bug fix/cleanup release.
MusicBrainz gets its first dedicated database server.
Improved search/cleanup.
Cleanup release.
Cleanup release.
Artist subscriptions
Bug fix/cleanup release.
Bug fix/cleanup release.
Bug fix/cleanup release.
Non album tracks are released.
Release editor and Guess Case released.
Link to MusicBrainz feature, release events and edit suggestions released.
Link to MusicBrainz feature, release events and edit suggestions released.
Inline edits, new reports, improved data import scripts.
Amazon coverart support released.
Caching (memcached) and bugs fixed.
Edit display improvements, turned off RDF dumps, new install scripts released.
Voting logic was improved, web based autoeditor elections released.
FreeDB auto import feature turned off and autoeditor elections released. Unused TRMs pruned from the database.
Annotation support released.
Artist subscriptions made public and various smaller user centric improvements are released.
Advanced relationships that allow users to connect basic data entities is relased and unused TRMs pruned from the database. Inline editing is turned off by default, causing a drop in voting activity.
The MetaBrainz Foundation, the legal home for MusicBrainz is announced to the public.
Album languages, guess case improvements and revamps edit forms released.
Top menu navigation improved, duplicate artists, album edit all, track time editing features released.
Style Guideline 5 workaround introduced and unused TRMs pruned from the database.
Linkara Musica becomes first commercial customer of MetaBrainz.
MusicBrainz moved to Digital West Networks in San Luis Obispo.
Indexes search and a new XML based Web Service are released.
MusicBrainz partners with MusicIP and starts using MusicDNS's PUID acoustic fingerprints. Picard becomes the official MusicBrainz tagger with PUID support, which causes edit activity to decrease.
An improved release editor and a new site design are released.
A rift in the MusicBrainz community leads to a Great Dispute.
The search features and web service improvements are released.
Support for Labels and data quality are released.
The BBC becomes a MetaBrainz customer and starts using MusicBrainz data.
Folksonomy tagging, editor subscriptions are released.
Last.fm signs up with MetaBrainz and starts using MusicBrainz data.
MetaWeb comes MusicBrainz data user.
MetaBrainz accepts three students for Google Summer of Code.
BBC launches the dynamic artist pages based on MusicBrainz data.
Amazon betas SoundUnwound with data from MusicBrainz.
Oliver Charles becomes employee #1 of MetaBrainz Foundation.
Collection, Ratings, CDStubs, LastUpdate released.
Release groups, ISRC support, CDStub searching and search fixes released.

event.title: Imported CD Baby catalog as CD Stubs

data.event: Imported the metadata from the CD Baby catalog into our CD Stubs collection.
NGS is released!
